body: Yes, I tried to put them in layers/kernels at first, but bazel would raise `crosses boundary of subpackages` error during build. After some googling, I found out that it's caused by the existing `BUILD` file in layers/kernels, but I couldn't figure out a way to write the build rules in this case, so I put the kernel codes in a separate folder as a temporary measure. It would be great if you could give me some guidance on how to write the build rules to resolve this.
body_html: Yes, I tried to put them in layers/kernels at first, but bazel would raise crosses boundary of subpackages error during build. After some googling, I found out that it's caused by the existing BUILD file in layers/kernels, but I couldn't figure out a way to write the build rules in this case, so I put the kernel codes in a separate folder as a temporary measure. It would be great if you could give me some guidance on how to write the build rules to resolve this.
body_text: Yes, I tried to put them in layers/kernels at first, but bazel would raise crosses boundary of subpackages error during build. After some googling, I found out that it's caused by the existing BUILD file in layers/kernels, but I couldn't figure out a way to write the build rules in this case, so I put the kernel codes in a separate folder as a temporary measure. It would be great if you could give me some guidance on how to write the build rules to resolve this.
